content.question:
"His commota fugam Dido sociosque parabat.

Conveniunt quibus aut odium crudele tyranni

aut metus acer erat; naves, quae forte paratae,

corripiunt onerantque auro. Portantur avari

5Pygmalionis opes pelago; dux femina facti.

Devenere locos ubi nunc ingentia cernis

moenia surgentemque novae Karthaginis arcem."

Aeneid 1. 360-366

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. What are the case and use of Dido (line 1) ?

2. In lines 1-4 (His . . . auro), which two Latin words mean that the stolen ships happened to be ready to sail?

3. In lines 1-4 (His . . . auro), which four Latin words can be translated "who had sharp fear"?

4. Which Latin word is the subject of Portantur (line 4) ?

5. (A) Which prominent, non-Roman leader from Vergil’s lifetime would also be considered a dux femina (line 5) like Dido and (B) in which battle did she fight?

6. In lines 6-7 (Devenere . . . arcem), (A) identify the participle and (B) translate it in context.

7. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 7 (moenia . . . arcem) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it.
